DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to investigate whether a combination of intensive training of visual-spatial abilities (LOCATO task) with anodal transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) leads to an improvement in learning and memory in patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and to examine the underlying neuronal mechanism.
DOC.brief_title: Modulation of Visual-Spatial Learning in Patients With Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) by tDCS
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria (MCI patients): right handedness amnestic and amnestic plus MCI with: 1. subjective memory impairment; 2. objective memory difficulties, at least 1 SD below gender, age and education adjusted standard values; 3. relatively normal performance in other cognitive domains; 4. no constraints in activities of daily livings 5. age: 5090 years severe internal or psychiatric disease epilepsy other severe neurological diseases, e.g. previous major stroke or brain tumor DMSIV manifest dementia contraindication for MRT (claustrophobia, metallic implants, tattoos)
